result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William E Horst

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William E Horst appeared by video.  Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell appeared by video for William E Horst.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf of Patrick T. Franken for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Discovery issues put forth on the record. Defense counsel requests an additional status conference date. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell in court for William E Horst.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense waiting for discovery and requested more time for review.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Attorney Robert LeBell

Adjustment Number: 22A 068573,
Payable Number: 1021065,
Receipt Number: 22RP029340,
Amount: $20.00

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Van Grunsven.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant William E Horst in court with Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.   
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to Branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant William E Horst in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/11/22 @ 1:30p
